archimate:DataObject.name: Reference Data
archimate:DataObject.documentation:
Small, discrete sets of values that are not updated as part of business transactions, but are usually used to impose consistent classification. Reference data normally has a low update frequency. Reference data is relevant across more than one business systems belonging to different organisations and sectors.
Source: ISA2 - SEMIC Action https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/methodology_and_tools_for_metadata_governance_and_management_for_eu_institutions.pdf
Reference data consists typically of a small, discrete set of values that are not updated as part of business transactions but are usually used to impose consistent classiﬁcation. Reference data normally has a low update frequency. Reference data is relevant across more than one business systems belonging to different organisations and sectors [source: J. Jordan & C. Ellen (2009). Business need, data and business intelligence].
